Topic.Title: HAVE YOU LOOKED AT THE YAHOO FINANCE GE BOARD?

Message.Msg: Two thoughts - First, if a icompany can't do something reasonably well, perhaps it shouldn't do it at all. Or at least it should strive to correct the worst faults. Again, can you imagine google or amazon or microsoft running message boards like GE? And second - perhaps Yahoo can only get tiny link fees since most of the viewers have absolutely no interest in what is being offered; or have clicked by accident; or perhaps that is the price for allowing serial message board stock spammers (scammers) to post free and compete with paying advertisers.

Message.Title: Yahoo Anxious to End Microsoft Search Deal
Message.Msg: According to my sources, Marissa Mayer is anxious to end Yahoo's current search agreement with Microsoft. Microsoft has offered Yahoo better terms, under what would become a new search agreement, but Marissa Mayer is not interested in partnering wit Microsoft. Instead, Marissa Mayer has been in talks with Sheryl Sandberg of Facebook to create their own partnership in search geared toward mobile users powered by Yahoo! Axis. More to come very soon.

Message.Title: Did Yahoo move its earnings date back 5 days because it wanted numbers from Alibaba?
Message.Msg: I wonder. Originally it was, I believe, the 22nd because I was looking at buying options a month or so ago but they were reporting a few days after Jan OEX so I started looking at the Feb's... I think that is what the push back was for. If I were to guess.... Nov. 11th was a $3 billion day for Alibaba and maybe Yahoo wanted to include those numbers. I think the revenues from Alibaba are the one thing that is going to surprise the street. Not one analyst is talking about $3billion usd in revenue that Alibaba did on Singles day (their black Friday). I was reading that most merchants weren't running low margins because they knew there was going to be a ton of traffic and they just didn't want to give the house away. If Alibaba ran a 15% profit (they usually average about 25%) on that day than you can plug in an additional $100 million in revenue for the quarter for Yahoo. Just a little thing to think about and jmho..... That would be a huge beat and since the street seems to be looking closely at revenues
